page.title: 04Thurlow School & community
page.content: Parents are very supportive and problems are rare, being sympathetically dealt with by the staff. Parents raise funds for the school by way of the Thurlow District Village Schools Association, filling the gap left by government spending cuts. Mothers help with the swimming rota and a father teaches football. The vicar introduces children to the church by holding the weekly stone wood and brass rubbing lessons there. A luncheon club for th elderly meets at school once a month. Children decorate the tables with flowers, greet their guests and take their coats, remember birthdays with songs and cards and most visitors then stay for afternoon school. School and WI together present the village Christmas concert and a yearly fete is held. Children go on to Parkway Middle.
